name: Saltworks Archipelago
role_in_state: Primary salt producer and coastal transshipment hub
economy_niches: fish curing and salted fish export
reagent storage and re-export for ritual suppliers
navigational augury services for salt routes
culture_adjustments: Island-variant Coastal Tongues with distinct sea-shanty corpus
Salt-guild ritual and gift-exchange dominates local contracts
Stronger emphasis on practical sea-omen rites of Sea-Tide tradition
Tidal-lease tenure and seasonal migrant labor for harvests
risks: piracy and raiding on small isles
constraints: scarce fresh water limits population and agriculture
corrosive environment restricts heavy industry and steamworks
ritual magic dependent on imported reagents with fragile supply lines
notes: Local governance heavily influenced by Salt Guilds and longshoremen fraternities
Tidal leases create overlapping communal and private rights; seasonal workforce flux
